name: AVAudioPlayer
desc: An object that plays audio data from a file or buffer.

items.name: init(contentsOf: URL)
items.desc: Creates a player to play audio from a file.

items.name: init(contentsOf: URL, fileTypeHint: String?)
items.desc: Creates a player to play audio from a file of a particular type.

items.name: init(data: Data)
items.desc: Creates a player to play in-memory audio data.

items.name: init(data: Data, fileTypeHint: String?)
items.desc: Creates a player to play in-memory audio data of a particular type.

items.name: func prepareToPlay() -> Bool
items.desc: Prepares the player for audio playback.

items.name: func play() -> Bool
items.desc: Plays audio asynchronously.

items.name: func play(atTime: TimeInterval) -> Bool
items.desc: Plays audio asynchronously, starting at a specified point in the audio output device’s timeline.

items.name: func pause()
items.desc: Pauses audio playback.

items.name: func stop()
items.desc: Stops playback and undoes the setup the system requires for playback.

items.name: var isPlaying: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the player is currently playing audio.

items.name: var volume: Float
items.desc: The audio player’s volume relative to other audio output.

items.name: func setVolume(Float, fadeDuration: TimeInterval)
items.desc: Changes the audio player’s volume over a duration of time.

items.name: var pan: Float
items.desc: The audio player’s stereo pan position.

items.name: var enableRate: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can adjust the playback rate of the audio player.

items.name: var rate: Float
items.desc: The audio player’s playback rate.

items.name: var numberOfLoops: Int
items.desc: The number of times the audio repeats playback.

items.name: var currentTime: TimeInterval
items.desc: The current playback time, in seconds, within the audio timeline.

items.name: var duration: TimeInterval
items.desc: The total duration, in seconds, of the player’s audio.

items.name: var numberOfChannels: Int
items.desc: The number of audio channels in the player’s audio.

items.name: var channelAssignments: [AVAudioSessionChannelDescription]?
items.desc: An array of channel descriptions for the audio player.

items.name: var isMeteringEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the player is able to generate audio-level metering data.

items.name: func updateMeters()
items.desc: Refreshes the average and peak power values for all channels of an audio player.

items.name: func averagePower(forChannel: Int) -> Float
items.desc: Returns the average power, in decibels full-scale (dBFS), for an audio channel.

items.name: func peakPower(forChannel: Int) -> Float
items.desc: Returns the peak power, in decibels full-scale (dBFS), for an audio channel.

items.name: var delegate: AVAudioPlayerDelegate?
items.desc: The delegate object for the audio player.

items.name: protocol AVAudioPlayerDelegate
items.desc: A protocol that defines the methods to respond to audio playback events and decoding errors.

items.name: var url: URL?
items.desc: The URL of the audio file.

items.name: var data: Data?
items.desc: The audio data associated with the player.

items.name: var format: AVAudioFormat
items.desc: The format of the player’s audio data.

items.name: var settings: [String : Any]
items.desc: A dictionary that provides information about the player’s audio data.

items.name: var currentDevice: String?
items.desc: The unique identifier of the current audio player.

items.name: var deviceCurrentTime: TimeInterval
items.desc: The time value, in seconds, of the audio output device’s clock.
